pokecraft.species.latias.desc: Latias is highly intelligent and capable of understanding human speech. It is covered with a glass-like down. The Pokémon enfolds its body with its down and refracts light to alter its appearance.
pokecraft.species.latios.name: Latios
pokecraft.species.latios.desc: Latios will only open its heart to a Trainer with a compassionate spirit. This Pokémon can fly faster than a jet plane by folding its forelegs to minimize air resistance.
pokecraft.species.kyogre.name: Kyogre
pokecraft.species.kyogre.desc: Kyogre is said to be the personification of the sea itself. Legends tell of its many clashes against Groudon, as each sought to gain the power of nature.
pokecraft.species.groudon.name: Groudon
pokecraft.species.groudon.desc: Through Primal Reversion and with nature’s full power, it will take back its true form. It can cause magma to erupt and expand the landmass of the world.
pokecraft.species.rayquaza.name: Rayquaza
pokecraft.species.rayquaza.desc: It flies forever through the ozone layer, consuming meteoroids for sustenance. The many meteoroids in its body provide the energy it needs to Mega Evolve.
pokecraft.species.jirachi.name: Jirachi
pokecraft.species.jirachi.desc: It’s believed that when this Pokémon wakes from its 1,000-year slumber, it will grant any wishes written on the notes attached to its head.
pokecraft.species.deoxys.name: Deoxys
pokecraft.species.deoxys.desc: Deoxys emerged from a virus that came from space. It is highly intelligent and wields psychokinetic powers. This Pokémon shoots lasers from the crystalline organ on its chest.
pokecraft.species.turtwig.name: Turtwig
pokecraft.species.turtwig.desc: This Pokémon becomes more energetic the more sunlight there is. The part resembling a shell is similar to silt and is slightly damp and warm to the touch.
pokecraft.species.grotle.name: Grotle
pokecraft.species.grotle.desc: Appears where there is clean spring water. The fruit that grows on the shrubs on its shell is sweet, nutritious, and truly delicious.
pokecraft.species.torterra.name: Torterra
pokecraft.species.torterra.desc: This remarkable, large-bodied Pokémon would serve beautifully as borrowed scenery for a garden, and its strength is peerless. Torterra roams the wilderness in search of clean water.
pokecraft.species.chimchar.name: Chimchar
pokecraft.species.chimchar.desc: Full of vigor and always in high spirits. It was once known by the name ”Lantern-Tail” and feared as some kind of apparition.
pokecraft.species.monferno.name: Monferno
pokecraft.species.monferno.desc: The deeper the blue on its face, the more powerful it will grow to become. It leaps about every which way and lands powerful blows against its opponents with the flame on its tail.
pokecraft.species.infernape.name: Infernape
pokecraft.species.infernape.desc: A tall, hardy Pokémon with a dazzling appearance. It shrouds itself in flame and battles as if engaged in dance—truly a sight to behold.
pokecraft.species.piplup.name: Piplup
pokecraft.species.piplup.desc: Prefers cold climes and appears along coasts. It's an adorable little thing—as cute as any child—but it's also prideful, unwilling to accept handouts from people.
pokecraft.species.prinplup.name: Prinplup
pokecraft.species.prinplup.desc: It swims gracefully through the frigid sea and sings with a voice like the roaring tide. It has powerful, sturdy wings and dignity to match.
pokecraft.species.empoleon.name: Empoleon
pokecraft.species.empoleon.desc: Since ancient times, it has been revered by the people of Hisui, who call it the Master of the Waves. Its wings are a match for even master-crafted blades.
pokecraft.species.starly.name: Starly
pokecraft.species.starly.desc: They live in the fields and mountains, gathering in large flocks. Their cries are quite obnoxious. Though small, their wings are strong—a strike from them leaves pain that persists for a week.
pokecraft.species.staravia.name: Staravia
pokecraft.species.staravia.desc: They form remarkably large flocks and are constantly fighting amongst themselves. I suspect that those with magnificent plumes on their heads are the strong ones.
pokecraft.species.staraptor.name: Staraptor
pokecraft.species.staraptor.desc: It has left the flock, having gained strength enough to survive on its own. The astounding force with which Staraptor flies through the air allows it to carry away large, burly targets.
pokecraft.species.bidoof.name: Bidoof
pokecraft.species.bidoof.desc: Bidoof has an unsophisticated face and is rarely flustered by anything. There have been incidents involving Bidoof sauntering into villages and gnawing on the houses without a single care.
pokecraft.species.bibarel.name: Bibarel
pokecraft.species.bibarel.desc: Bibarel fur repels water and is also a fantastic material for heat retention. These Pokémon create dams on rivers to live in.
pokecraft.species.kricketot.name: Kricketot
pokecraft.species.kricketot.desc: When the trees take on new hues, more of these Pokémon appear. The tone they create by striking their antennae together resembles that of the marimba, an instrument of foreign lands.
pokecraft.species.kricketune.name: Kricketune
pokecraft.species.kricketune.desc: It uses its cutlass-like arms to produce sound, the melody of which varies from individual to individual. It is a worthwhile endeavor to seek out one's favorite tunes.
pokecraft.species.shinx.name: Shinx
pokecraft.species.shinx.desc: Shakes its body to generate electricity. Its stature belies its aggression—one must be patient to tame this Pokémon.
pokecraft.species.luxio.name: Luxio
pokecraft.species.luxio.desc: Proudly uses its electrified claws as weapons. It seems to be a gracious Pokémon, evenly sharing the spoils of the hunt with others of its kind.
pokecraft.species.luxray.name: Luxray
pokecraft.species.luxray.desc: They form packs, each having one male as leader. Legends say that when Luxray's two eyes shimmer with gold, the Pokémon can see through anything.
pokecraft.species.budew.name: Budew
pokecraft.species.budew.desc: When the sun's light strengthens, the bud atop this Pokémon's head opens. This is a sign to the people that the harsh winter is over, and the season of budding has begun.
pokecraft.species.roserade.name: Roserade
pokecraft.species.roserade.desc: Hidden within the bouquet on each hand are thorned whips loaded with virulent poison. Roserade moves gracefully as it corners its prey and mercilessly lashes them with its whips.
pokecraft.species.cranidos.name: Cranidos
pokecraft.species.cranidos.desc: An incredibly rare sight. They duel each other by ramming their heads together, and the resulting sound echoes throughout the area like the pealing of a bell.
pokecraft.species.rampardos.name: Rampardos
pokecraft.species.rampardos.desc: Very little is known about its biology. Can knock down massive trees by smashing its beautiful, pearl-like crown against them.
pokecraft.species.shieldon.name: Shieldon
pokecraft.species.shieldon.desc: Much remains unknown about this Pokémon, as few have ever seen it. However, we know that it is calm and dislikes conflict, and it enjoys polishing its face against trees and rocks.
pokecraft.species.bastiodon.name: Bastiodon
pokecraft.species.bastiodon.desc: Its face is sturdy—as strong as diamond—and this hardness offers a very stable defense. Much about this species is still unknown, such as its natural habitat.
pokecraft.species.burmy.name: Burmy
pokecraft.species.burmy.desc: If its cloak is even slightly damaged, Burmy will immediately repair it with whatever is close at hand. The Pokémon within the cloak is scrawny and vulnerable to the cold.
pokecraft.species.wormadam.name: Wormadam
pokecraft.species.wormadam.desc: When Burmy evolved, its cloak became a part of this Pokémon’s body. The cloak is never shed.
pokecraft.species.mothim.name: Mothim
pokecraft.species.mothim.desc: Scatters steel-colored scales as it flaps its wings. Despite being observed feeding primarily on the nectar of flowers, Mothim is not often seen around flower gardens.
pokecraft.species.combee.name: Combee
pokecraft.species.combee.desc: They swear fealty to a queen Pokémon and work diligently to gather nectar. Each swarm produces a different flavor of honey.
pokecraft.species.vespiquen.name: Vespiquen
pokecraft.species.vespiquen.desc: Commands its subjects to build its hive. It will dispatch any interlopers who dare sneak into its nest and use them as nourishment for itself.
pokecraft.species.pachirisu.name: Pachirisu
pokecraft.species.pachirisu.desc: A species related to the Pikachu line. Though Pachirisu is a calm Pokémon, it still presents a danger should one touch its electrified tail or cheeks.
pokecraft.species.buizel.name: Buizel
pokecraft.species.buizel.desc: It moves freely in the water by spinning its forked tail for propulsion. The resemblance to the screw of a steamboat is coincidental.
pokecraft.species.floatzel.name: Floatzel
pokecraft.species.floatzel.desc: Has a long, rather splendid flotation sac, which prevents Floatzel from drowning even in stormy seas. One might glimpse this species around fishing hamlets from time to time.
pokecraft.species.cherubi.name: Cherubi
pokecraft.species.cherubi.desc: Once the fruit growing alongside the main body is large and plump, Cherubi will use the nutrients within to evolve. The fruit then detaches, becoming nourishment for other creatures.
pokecraft.species.cherrim.name: Cherrim
pokecraft.species.cherrim.desc: Motionless, save for the occasional quiver. A rich array of Pokémon can be found gathered around it, drawn by the scent exuded from Cherrim's folded petals.
pokecraft.species.shellos.name: Shellos
pokecraft.species.shellos.desc: Found in abundance on seashores bordering warm waters. Shellos are unexpectedly friendly and will crawl toward any person they see. Take care not to get coated in mucus!
pokecraft.species.gastrodon.name: Gastrodon
pokecraft.species.gastrodon.desc: Eats beach sand for nourishment. Should one Gastrodon encounter another of a different color, a fierce battle will inevitably ensue.
pokecraft.species.ambipom.name: Ambipom
pokecraft.species.ambipom.desc: To affirm their kinship, members of this species will form a ring by linking their newly doubled tails together. On rare occasions, humans have been accepted into such rings.
pokecraft.species.drifloon.name: Drifloon
pokecraft.species.drifloon.desc: Said to lure away young children and carry them off to the afterlife. Some whisper that Drifloon are formed of reincarnated human souls, but these rumors are as yet unconfirmed.
pokecraft.species.drifblim.name: Drifblim
pokecraft.species.drifblim.desc: It drifts along at dusk, perfectly silent. Its transient, melancholy aspect touches some people deeply—every so often, one will come upon a song or poem devoted to Drifblim.
pokecraft.species.buneary.name: Buneary
pokecraft.species.buneary.desc: My hypothesis as to why Buneary rolls up its ears is that its hearing is far too keen. I surmise that the Pokémon protects its hearing by limiting the sound that may enter its ears.
pokecraft.species.lopunny.name: Lopunny
pokecraft.species.lopunny.desc: Its fur is warm and yet remarkably light. This Pokémon kicks as though it were a master of karate, driving back its opponents with ease.
pokecraft.species.mismagius.name: Mismagius
pokecraft.species.mismagius.desc: The incantations Mismagius chants can ward against misfortune, so a custom exists of inviting it into one's home. Incur the Pokémon's displeasure, however, and disaster will surely ensue.
pokecraft.species.honchkrow.name: Honchkrow
pokecraft.species.honchkrow.desc: One cry from this Pokémon, and a murder of Murkrow come flying. At such times, one would think the curtain of night had fallen, plunging the world into jet-black darkness.
pokecraft.species.glameow.name: Glameow
pokecraft.species.glameow.desc: Bewitches humans with its helical tail and piercing gaze. Its hidden claws are quite sharp as well, making this Pokémon an exceedingly tricky opponent if antagonized.
pokecraft.species.purugly.name: Purugly
pokecraft.species.purugly.desc: Though impudent and difficult to tame, Purugly enjoys great popularity due to its fur, the beauty of which surpasses even velveteen.
pokecraft.species.chingling.name: Chingling
pokecraft.species.chingling.desc: This Pokémon gave me an excruciating headache when it seemingly cried out without making a sound. Perhaps there are some sounds that the human ear is simply incapable of hearing.
pokecraft.species.stunky.name: Stunky
pokecraft.species.stunky.desc: The poison that gushes from its aft end is accompanied by an utterly evil-smelling odor with such potency that one whiff can induce memory loss.
pokecraft.species.skuntank.name: Skuntank
pokecraft.species.skuntank.desc: Sprays a poisonous fluid to take down prey. Sometimes, unable to stomach the stench of its own fluid, it leaves the bested prey uneaten.
pokecraft.species.bronzor.name: Bronzor
pokecraft.species.bronzor.desc: Floats using a mysterious energy. The pattern engraved upon its back is held as sacred and can sometimes be found in imagery from ancient cemeteries and other such timeworn places.
pokecraft.species.bronzong.name: Bronzong
pokecraft.species.bronzong.desc: Some believe that its bell-like cry opens holes to another world. It has been revered as a deity since ancient times.
pokecraft.species.bonsly.name: Bonsly
pokecraft.species.bonsly.desc: Its tears elicit sympathy from those who see them, but do not be deceived! This expulsion of body water is merely a physiological mechanism for keeping itself in good health.
pokecraft.species.mimejr.name: Mime Jr.
pokecraft.species.mimejr.desc: Known to turn up in bustling marketplaces now and again. It mimics people much as a child would, then watches how they react, eyes sparkling.
pokecraft.species.happiny.name: Happiny
pokecraft.species.happiny.desc: In imitation of Chansey, it keeps a round stone tucked into its belly pouch and cherishes it dearly. It gets along well with children and will sometimes play house with them for fun.
pokecraft.species.chatot.name: Chatot
pokecraft.species.chatot.desc: A versatile performer skilled in the imitation of human speech. It is said that older, more experienced Chatot can even understand the meaning of the words they mimic.
pokecraft.species.spiritomb.name: Spiritomb
pokecraft.species.spiritomb.desc: It lays curses by thinking wicked thoughts. Writings tell that this Pokémon was born out of the assembly of five score and eight malevolent spirits.
pokecraft.species.gible.name: Gible
pokecraft.species.gible.desc: It nests in caves untouched by sunlight. Its sharp teeth may fall out when worn away or after an impact, but they regrow within a few days.
pokecraft.species.gabite.name: Gabite
pokecraft.species.gabite.desc: Though Gabite are usually of a violent disposition, when I gave one a glass bead it had been eyeing covetously, it suddenly became quite docile.
pokecraft.species.garchomp.name: Garchomp
pokecraft.species.garchomp.desc: Soars across the heavens at blinding speed—a magnificent sight! It has a feral disposition. Utmost caution is required if one meets a Garchomp out in the wilds.
pokecraft.species.munchlax.name: Munchlax
pokecraft.species.munchlax.desc: Its robust stomach allows it to nonchalantly devour even rotted matter. It pays frequent visits to villages, seeking out food scraps intended for compost.
pokecraft.species.riolu.name: Riolu
pokecraft.species.riolu.desc: Though infantile in appearance, it has the mysterious ability to read the minds of humans. The pure of heart are met with Riolu's approval, while those of ill nature earn only its loathing.
pokecraft.species.lucario.name: Lucario
pokecraft.species.lucario.desc: A most gallant-looking creature. It emits energy waves and controls them with precision, using them to sense even faraway beings. I have given the name ”aura” to this power.
pokecraft.species.hippopotas.name: Hippopotas
pokecraft.species.hippopotas.desc: Though large and languid, Hippopotas is difficult to detect due to its tendency to burrow into and lurk beneath the soil. When agitated or excited, it expels sand from its nostrils.
pokecraft.species.hippowdon.name: Hippowdon
pokecraft.species.hippowdon.desc: Short-tempered and easily moved to violence. It whips up whirlwinds of sand to crush its foes' spirits, then goes in for the attack.
pokecraft.species.skorupi.name: Skorupi
pokecraft.species.skorupi.desc: Its claws are not only razor-sharp but poisonous, making Skorupi a highly dangerous Pokémon. It seems to be weakened by cold temperatures, however.
pokecraft.species.drapion.name: Drapion
pokecraft.species.drapion.desc: Has a brutish, ferocious temperament. With immense strength and a sturdy shell off which swords will bounce, it rampages about and wreaks havoc.
pokecraft.species.croagunk.name: Croagunk
pokecraft.species.croagunk.desc: A poison wielder with a dastardly personality. Despite such qualities, this species is afforded a measure of popularity due to its peculiar cry and comical features.
pokecraft.species.toxicroak.name: Toxicroak
pokecraft.species.toxicroak.desc: Its crimson claws contain a virulent toxin. This toxin can be made into a tonic by diluting it, mixing it with several types of wild grass, and boiling it down over two days.
pokecraft.species.carnivine.name: Carnivine
pokecraft.species.carnivine.desc: Though this is a plant Pokémon, it has a gluttonous and unruly temperament. Carnivine attacks its prey with its cavernous maw wide open.
pokecraft.species.finneon.name: Finneon
pokecraft.species.finneon.desc: What a gorgeous sight this Pokémon is as it swims with its long, pink-painted caudal fins fluttering behind it. Finneon's beautiful appearance has led to its nickname: ”finery fish.”
pokecraft.species.lumineon.name: Lumineon
pokecraft.species.lumineon.desc: Uses its gleaming fins to hunt its prey. The view of Lumineon schooling near the surface of the sea at night is breathtaking— it's as though there were shining stars right there.
pokecraft.species.mantyke.name: Mantyke
pokecraft.species.mantyke.desc: Though ball-like in shape, this Pokémon is a proficient swimmer. I have discovered that if a Mantyke spends much time with schools of Remoraid, it will eventually achieve evolution.
pokecraft.species.snover.name: Snover
pokecraft.species.snover.desc: One is likely to encounter this Pokémon while out in the snow. There are stories of Snover appearing in human settlements but doing no harm—rather, they bond with the children.
pokecraft.species.abomasnow.name: Abomasnow
pokecraft.species.abomasnow.desc: A powerful Pokémon that can split huge boulders with ease. Dislikes associating with others and chooses to live quietly deep within the mountains, playing with the snow.
pokecraft.species.weavile.name: Weavile
pokecraft.species.weavile.desc: This species corners prey as a pack, under the guidance of a leader. Weavile displays increased cunning, leading me to speculate that its evolution caused further brain development.
pokecraft.species.magnezone.name: Magnezone
pokecraft.species.magnezone.desc: I theorize that a special magnetic field influenced this Pokémon, changing its molecular structure and causing it to evolve. It emits strange radio waves toward space from its antenna.
pokecraft.species.lickilicky.name: Lickilicky
pokecraft.species.lickilicky.desc: Its tongue can extend and contract freely, and it is capable of reaching lengths over 10 times Lickilicky's height. Beware of the saliva, as it contains corrosive elements.
pokecraft.species.rhyperior.name: Rhyperior
pokecraft.species.rhyperior.desc: This Pokémon evolved through use of a curious item. Its rocklike hide is composed of a mysterious substance and can withstand a blow from a masterwork sword with nary a scratch.
pokecraft.species.tangrowth.name: Tangrowth
pokecraft.species.tangrowth.desc: Draped with long vines, it resembles a shrub in appearance. It swings bundles of vines as though they were arms, wrapping them around prey to ensnare them.
pokecraft.species.electivire.name: Electivire
pokecraft.species.electivire.desc: Its evolution was induced by an unusual item, and its electrical output rises along with its heart rate. From its tails, it can unleash an electric current measuring 20,000 volts.
pokecraft.species.magmortar.name: Magmortar
pokecraft.species.magmortar.desc: Use of a strange item caused this Pokémon to evolve. Fireballs launched from the ends of its tubelike arms are hot enough to melt an iron pot in an instant.
pokecraft.species.togekiss.name: Togekiss
pokecraft.species.togekiss.desc: Scant few have ever sighted this Pokémon. After studying what literature remains, I am certain Togekiss will reveal itself when peace reigns in the land.
pokecraft.species.yanmega.name: Yanmega
pokecraft.species.yanmega.desc: Extremely violent. When hunting, it wastes none of its energy, aiming only for prey's most vulnerable spots. Any who manage to tame this Pokémon must be of incredible bravery.
pokecraft.species.leafeon.name: Leafeon
pokecraft.species.leafeon.desc: Cells similar to those of plants have been found in its fur. Its hard tail can fell a large tree with one stroke, and the tail's sharpness exceeds even that of a sword crafted by a master.
pokecraft.species.glaceon.name: Glaceon
pokecraft.species.glaceon.desc: Glaceon is able to lower its body temperature very quickly. It freezes the atmosphere, creating diamond dust that glitters like gems while it flutters and dances around.
pokecraft.species.gliscor.name: Gliscor
pokecraft.species.gliscor.desc: It glides soundlessly on pitch-black wings and sinks sharp fangs into the throat of its prey. It takes on a look of satisfaction once it has entirely drained its prey of blood.
pokecraft.species.mamoswine.name: Mamoswine
pokecraft.species.mamoswine.desc: This species reached its zenith during the period known as the ice age. I suspect that Hisui's frigid climate is in harmony with Mamoswine's constitution, thus awakening hidden potential.
pokecraft.species.porygonz.name: Porygon-Z
pokecraft.species.porygonz.desc: A curious item induced this evolution. The Pokémon's offensive capabilities have greatly increased, but the strangeness of its behavior has magnified in equal measure. This worries me.
pokecraft.species.gallade.name: Gallade
pokecraft.species.gallade.desc: The blades extending from its elbows are sharper than the finest swords. Its swordsmanship, albeit self-taught, is astonishingly impressive.
pokecraft.species.probopass.name: Probopass
pokecraft.species.probopass.desc: It is able to emit powerful magnetism, allowing it control over the iron sand that forms its luscious mustache. Using this iron sand, Probopass forms hard stones with which it smites its prey.
pokecraft.species.dusknoir.name: Dusknoir
pokecraft.species.dusknoir.desc: Comes to those whose lives have come to an end and escorts their souls to the afterlife. Known to mistakenly take the souls of those who yet have life left in them, albeit rarely.
pokecraft.species.froslass.name: Froslass
pokecraft.species.froslass.desc: A Pokémon inhabited by the soul of a woman who died bearing a grudge in the snowy mountains. Legends of Froslass placing deathly curses on misbehaving men send shivers down my spine.
pokecraft.species.rotom.name: Rotom
pokecraft.species.rotom.desc: This bizarre Pokémon appears to be a will-o'-the-wisp powered by electricity. Be wary, as Rotom is both smart and mischievous.
pokecraft.species.uxie.name: Uxie
pokecraft.species.uxie.desc: A Pokémon feared but also respected for stealing away the memories of evildoers. I have found records that suggest Uxie holds dominion over knowledge.
pokecraft.species.mesprit.name: Mesprit
pokecraft.species.mesprit.desc: Known as the Being of Emotion. In legend, this Pokémon was feared, as any who showed disrespect would have their emotions thrown into disarray.
pokecraft.species.azelf.name: Azelf
pokecraft.species.azelf.desc: The dreaded Being of Willpower. Legends tell of this Pokémon manipulating the will of its adversaries and turning them into puppets of its own.
pokecraft.species.dialga.name: Dialga
pokecraft.species.dialga.desc: This Pokémon is revered as a deity in Hisuian legend. The birth of Dialga was what caused the vast river of time to begin flowing in our world.
pokecraft.species.palkia.name: Palkia
pokecraft.species.palkia.desc: This Pokémon is feared as a deity in Hisuian legend. The birth of Palkia was what caused the walls of our world to disappear, creating a sky that spans for infinity.
pokecraft.species.heatran.name: Heatran
pokecraft.species.heatran.desc: Stories tell of this Pokémon being birthed from the boiling magma within Mount Coronet. Its molten-steel body holds many mysteries.
pokecraft.species.regigigas.name: Regigigas
pokecraft.species.regigigas.desc: According to legend, Regigigas pulled landmasses together and bound them with rope to create the continent of Hisui. Though I have my doubts, the story could well contain a shred of truth.
pokecraft.species.giratina.name: Giratina
pokecraft.species.giratina.desc: There is one Hisuian verse that tells of a powerful light creating a deep shadow. I imagine that this deep shadow is Giratina.
pokecraft.species.cresselia.name: Cresselia
pokecraft.species.cresselia.desc: Cresselia is reminiscent of the crescent moon. It leaves a brilliant line of light in its wake as it flies across the night sky. I daresay it resembles the heavenly maiden who created the Milky Way.
pokecraft.species.phione.name: Phione
pokecraft.species.phione.desc: Can be seen floating offshore during seasons when the seas are warm. Its azure body blends in with the ocean waters—logic suggests this is a defense mechanism against natural predators.
pokecraft.species.manaphy.name: Manaphy
pokecraft.species.manaphy.desc: Rumored to migrate across the oceans and visit Hisui's coastal waters only rarely. Although Manaphy resembles Phione, it is also quite different. The relation between the two is unclear.
pokecraft.species.darkrai.name: Darkrai
pokecraft.species.darkrai.desc: On a moonless night, a strange incident occurred in which every one of a village's inhabitants suffered nightmares. The villagers attested that Darkrai appeared before them in these nightmares.
pokecraft.species.shaymin.name: Shaymin
pokecraft.species.shaymin.desc: When the turning of seasons brings the cruel winter to its end and the joyous people give thanks to the heavens, Shaymin appears and covers the withered land with flowers.
pokecraft.species.arceus.name: Arceus
pokecraft.species.arceus.desc: It is the heavenly fount from which pours the light that shines across Hisui. Its luminance guides and protects all Pokémon. Hisuian mythology states that Arceus is the creator of all things.
pokecraft.species.victini.name: Victini
pokecraft.species.victini.desc: When it shares the infinite energy it creates, that being’s entire body will be overflowing with power.
pokecraft.species.snivy.name: Snivy
pokecraft.species.snivy.desc: They photosynthesize by bathing their tails in sunlight. When they are not feeling well, their tails droop.
pokecraft.species.servine.name: Servine
pokecraft.species.servine.desc: When it gets dirty, its leaves can’t be used in photosynthesis, so it always keeps itself clean.
pokecraft.species.serperior.name: Serperior
pokecraft.species.serperior.desc: It can stop its opponents’ movements with just a glare. It takes in solar energy and boosts it internally.
pokecraft.species.tepig.name: Tepig
pokecraft.species.tepig.desc: It loves to eat roasted berries, but sometimes it gets too excited and burns them to a crisp.
pokecraft.species.pignite.name: Pignite
pokecraft.species.pignite.desc: When its internal fire flares up, its movements grow sharper and faster. When in trouble, it emits smoke.
pokecraft.species.emboar.name: Emboar
pokecraft.species.emboar.desc: It has mastered fast and powerful fighting moves. It grows a beard of fire.
pokecraft.species.oshawott.name: Oshawott
pokecraft.species.oshawott.desc: This Pokémon from the Unova region uses the shell on its belly as a weapon to cut down its foes. Thus, I've conferred upon this shell the name ”scalchop”.
pokecraft.species.dewott.name: Dewott
pokecraft.species.dewott.desc: Its exquisite double-scalchop technique is likely the result of daily training, and it can send even masters of the blade fleeing in defeat.
pokecraft.species.samurott.name: Samurott
pokecraft.species.samurott.desc: Hard of heart and deft of blade, this rare form of Samurott is a product of the Pokémon's evolution in the region of Hisui. Its turbulent blows crash into foes like ceaseless pounding waves.
pokecraft.species.patrat.name: Patrat
pokecraft.species.patrat.desc: Extremely cautious, one of them will always be on the lookout, but it won’t notice a foe coming from behind.
pokecraft.species.watchog.name: Watchog
pokecraft.species.watchog.desc: When they see an enemy, their tails stand high, and they spit the seeds of berries stored in their cheek pouches.
pokecraft.species.lillipup.name: Lillipup
pokecraft.species.lillipup.desc: This Pokémon is far brighter than the average child, and Lillipup won’t forget the love it receives or any abuse it suffers.
pokecraft.species.herdier.name: Herdier
pokecraft.species.herdier.desc: The black fur that covers this Pokémon’s body is dense and springy. Even sharp fangs bounce right off.
pokecraft.species.stoutland.name: Stoutland
pokecraft.species.stoutland.desc: Stoutland is immensely proud of its impressive moustache. It’s said that moustache length is what determines social standing among this species.
pokecraft.species.purrloin.name: Purrloin
pokecraft.species.purrloin.desc: Opponents that get drawn in by its adorable behavior come away with stinging scratches from its claws and stinging pride from its laughter.
pokecraft.species.liepard.name: Liepard
pokecraft.species.liepard.desc: This stealthy Pokémon sneaks up behind prey without making any sound at all. It competes with Thievul for territory.
pokecraft.species.pansage.name: Pansage
pokecraft.species.pansage.desc: It’s good at finding berries and gathers them from all over. It’s kind enough to share them with friends.
pokecraft.species.simisage.name: Simisage
pokecraft.species.simisage.desc: Ill tempered, it fights by swinging its barbed tail around wildly. The leaf growing on its head is very bitter.
pokecraft.species.pansear.name: Pansear
pokecraft.species.pansear.desc: This Pokémon lives in caves in volcanoes. The fire within the tuft on its head can reach 600 degrees Fahrenheit.
pokecraft.species.simisear.name: Simisear
pokecraft.species.simisear.desc: When it gets excited, embers rise from its head and tail and it gets hot. For some reason, it loves sweets.
pokecraft.species.panpour.name: Panpour
pokecraft.species.panpour.desc: The water stored inside the tuft on its head is full of nutrients. Plants that receive its water grow large.
pokecraft.species.simipour.name: Simipour
pokecraft.species.simipour.desc: It prefers places with clean water. When its tuft runs low, it replenishes it by siphoning up water with its tail.
pokecraft.species.munna.name: Munna
pokecraft.species.munna.desc: It eats dreams and releases mist. The mist is pink when it’s eating a good dream, and black when it’s eating a nightmare.
pokecraft.species.musharna.name: Musharna
pokecraft.species.musharna.desc: It drowses and dreams all the time. It’s best to leave it be if it’s just woken up, as it’s a terrible grump when freshly roused from sleep.
pokecraft.species.pidove.name: Pidove
pokecraft.species.pidove.desc: It’s forgetful and not very bright, but many Trainers love it anyway for its friendliness and sincerity.
pokecraft.species.tranquill.name: Tranquill
pokecraft.species.tranquill.desc: These bright Pokémon have acute memories. Apparently delivery workers often choose them as their partners.
pokecraft.species.unfezant.name: Unfezant
pokecraft.species.unfezant.desc: This Pokémon is intelligent and intensely proud. People will sit up and take notice if you become the Trainer of one.
pokecraft.species.blitzle.name: Blitzle
pokecraft.species.blitzle.desc: Its mane shines when it discharges electricity. They use the frequency and rhythm of these flashes to communicate.
pokecraft.species.zebstrika.name: Zebstrika
pokecraft.species.zebstrika.desc: They have lightning-like movements. When Zebstrika run at full speed, the sound of thunder reverberates.
pokecraft.species.roggenrola.name: Roggenrola
pokecraft.species.roggenrola.desc: When it detects a noise, it starts to move. The energy core inside it makes this Pokémon slightly warm to the touch.
pokecraft.species.boldore.name: Boldore
pokecraft.species.boldore.desc: It relies on sound in order to monitor what’s in its vicinity. When angered, it will attack without ever changing the direction it’s facing.
pokecraft.species.gigalith.name: Gigalith
pokecraft.species.gigalith.desc: Although its energy blasts can blow away a dump truck, they have a limitation— they can only be fired when the sun is out.
pokecraft.species.woobat.name: Woobat
pokecraft.species.woobat.desc: It emits ultrasonic waves as it flutters about, searching for its prey—bug Pokémon.
pokecraft.species.swoobat.name: Swoobat
pokecraft.species.swoobat.desc: The auspicious shape of this Pokémon’s nose apparently led some regions to consider Swoobat a symbol of good luck.
pokecraft.species.drilbur.name: Drilbur
pokecraft.species.drilbur.desc: It’s a digger, using its claws to burrow through the ground. It causes damage to vegetable crops, so many farmers have little love for it.
pokecraft.species.excadrill.name: Excadrill
pokecraft.species.excadrill.desc: Known as the Drill King, this Pokémon can tunnel through the terrain at speeds of over 90 mph.
pokecraft.species.audino.name: Audino
pokecraft.species.audino.desc: This Pokémon has a kind heart. By touching with its feelers, Audino can gauge other creatures’ feelings and physical conditions.
pokecraft.species.timburr.name: Timburr
pokecraft.species.timburr.desc: Timburr that have started carrying logs that are about three times their size are nearly ready to evolve.
pokecraft.species.gurdurr.name: Gurdurr
pokecraft.species.gurdurr.desc: Gurdurr excels at demolition—construction is not its forte. In any case, there’s skill in the way this Pokémon wields its metal beam.
pokecraft.species.conkeldurr.name: Conkeldurr
pokecraft.species.conkeldurr.desc: When going all out, this Pokémon throws aside its concrete pillars and leaps at opponents to pummel them with its fists.
pokecraft.species.tympole.name: Tympole
pokecraft.species.tympole.desc: It uses sound waves to communicate with others of its kind. People and other Pokémon species can’t hear its cries of warning.
pokecraft.species.palpitoad.name: Palpitoad
pokecraft.species.palpitoad.desc: On occasion, their cries are sublimely pleasing to the ear. Palpitoad with larger lumps on their bodies can sing with a wider range of sounds.
pokecraft.species.seismitoad.name: Seismitoad
pokecraft.species.seismitoad.desc: This Pokémon is popular among the elderly, who say the vibrations of its lumps are great for massages.
pokecraft.species.throh.name: Throh
pokecraft.species.throh.desc: They train in groups of five. Any member that can’t keep up will discard its belt and leave the group.
pokecraft.species.sawk.name: Sawk
pokecraft.species.sawk.desc: The karate chops of a Sawk that’s trained itself to the limit can cleave the ocean itself.
pokecraft.species.sewaddle.name: Sewaddle
pokecraft.species.sewaddle.desc: Since this Pokémon makes its own clothes out of leaves, it is a popular mascot for fashion designers.
pokecraft.species.swadloon.name: Swadloon
pokecraft.species.swadloon.desc: It protects itself from the cold by wrapping up in leaves. It stays on the move, eating leaves in forests.
pokecraft.species.leavanny.name: Leavanny
pokecraft.species.leavanny.desc: It keeps its eggs warm with heat from fermenting leaves. It also uses leaves to make warm wrappings for Sewaddle.
pokecraft.species.venipede.name: Venipede
pokecraft.species.venipede.desc: Its fangs are highly venomous. If this Pokémon finds prey it thinks it can eat, it leaps for them without any thought of how things might turn out.
pokecraft.species.whirlipede.name: Whirlipede
pokecraft.species.whirlipede.desc: Whirlipede protects itself with a sturdy shell and poisonous spikes while it stores up the energy it’ll need for evolution.
pokecraft.species.scolipede.name: Scolipede
pokecraft.species.scolipede.desc: Scolipede engage in fierce territorial battles with Centiskorch. At the end of one of these battles, the victor makes a meal of the loser.
pokecraft.species.cottonee.name: Cottonee
pokecraft.species.cottonee.desc: Weaving together the cotton of both Cottonee and Eldegoss produces exquisite cloth that’s highly prized by many luxury brands.
pokecraft.species.whimsicott.name: Whimsicott
pokecraft.species.whimsicott.desc: As long as this Pokémon bathes in sunlight, its cotton keeps growing. If too much cotton fluff builds up, Whimsicott tears it off and scatters it.
pokecraft.species.petilil.name: Petilil
pokecraft.species.petilil.desc: The leaves on its head are highly valued for medicinal purposes. Dry the leaves in the sun, boil them, and then drink the bitter decoction for remarkably effective relief from fatigue.
pokecraft.species.lilligant.name: Lilligant
pokecraft.species.lilligant.desc: I suspect that its well-developed legs are the result of a life spent on mountains covered in deep snow. The scent it exudes from its flower crown heartens those in proximity.
pokecraft.species.basculin.name: Basculin
pokecraft.species.basculin.desc: Though it differs from other Basculin in several respects, including demeanor—this one is gentle—I have categorized it as a regional form given the vast array of shared qualities.
pokecraft.species.sandile.name: Sandile
pokecraft.species.sandile.desc: Sandile is small, but its legs and lower body are powerful. Pushing sand aside as it goes, Sandile moves through the desert as if it’s swimming.
pokecraft.species.krokorok.name: Krokorok
pokecraft.species.krokorok.desc: Although this Pokémon has specialized eyes that allow it to see in the dark, Krokorok won’t move much at night—the desert gets cold after sunset.
pokecraft.species.krookodile.name: Krookodile
pokecraft.species.krookodile.desc: While terribly aggressive, Krookodile also has the patience to stay hidden under sand for days, lying in wait for prey.
pokecraft.species.darumaka.name: Darumaka
pokecraft.species.darumaka.desc: This popular symbol of good fortune will never fall over in its sleep, no matter how it’s pushed or pulled.
pokecraft.species.darmanitan.name: Darmanitan
pokecraft.species.darmanitan.desc: This Pokémon’s power level rises along with the temperature of its fire, which can reach 2,500 degrees Fahrenheit.
pokecraft.species.maractus.name: Maractus
pokecraft.species.maractus.desc: Once each year, this Pokémon scatters its seeds. They’re jam-packed with nutrients, making them a precious food source out in the desert.
pokecraft.species.dwebble.name: Dwebble
pokecraft.species.dwebble.desc: It first tries to find a rock to live in, but if there are no suitable rocks to be found, Dwebble may move in to the ports of a Hippowdon.
pokecraft.species.crustle.name: Crustle
pokecraft.species.crustle.desc: Its thick claws are its greatest weapons. They’re mighty enough to crack Rhyperior’s carapace.
pokecraft.species.scraggy.name: Scraggy
pokecraft.species.scraggy.desc: It protects itself with its durable skin. It’s thought that this Pokémon will evolve once its skin has completely stretched out.
pokecraft.species.scrafty.name: Scrafty
pokecraft.species.scrafty.desc: While mostly known for having the temperament of an aggressive ruffian, this Pokémon takes very good care of its family, friends, and territory.
pokecraft.species.sigilyph.name: Sigilyph
pokecraft.species.sigilyph.desc: A discovery was made in the desert where Sigilyph fly. The ruins of what may have been an ancient city were found beneath the sands.
pokecraft.species.yamask.name: Yamask
pokecraft.species.yamask.desc: The spirit of a person from a bygone age became this Pokémon. It rambles through ruins, searching for someone who knows its face.
pokecraft.species.cofagrigus.name: Cofagrigus
pokecraft.species.cofagrigus.desc: There are many depictions of Cofagrigus decorating ancient tombs. They’re symbols of the wealth that kings of bygone eras had.
pokecraft.species.tirtouga.name: Tirtouga
pokecraft.species.tirtouga.desc: Tirtouga is considered to be the ancestor of many turtle Pokémon. It was restored to life from a fossil.
pokecraft.species.carracosta.name: Carracosta
pokecraft.species.carracosta.desc: This Pokémon emerges from the water in search of prey despite the fact that it moves more slowly on land.
pokecraft.species.archen.name: Archen
pokecraft.species.archen.desc: Archen is said to be the ancestor of bird Pokémon. It lived in treetops, eating berries and bug Pokémon.
pokecraft.species.archeops.name: Archeops
pokecraft.species.archeops.desc: Though capable of flight, Archeops was apparently better at hunting on the ground.
pokecraft.species.trubbish.name: Trubbish
pokecraft.species.trubbish.desc: This Pokémon was born from a bag stuffed with trash. Galarian Weezing relish the fumes belched by Trubbish.
pokecraft.species.garbodor.name: Garbodor
pokecraft.species.garbodor.desc: The toxic liquid it launches from its right arm is so virulent that it can kill a weakened creature instantly.
pokecraft.species.zorua.name: Zorua
pokecraft.species.zorua.desc: A once-departed soul, returned to life in Hisui. Derives power from resentment, which rises as energy atop its head and takes on the forms of foes. In this way, Zorua vents lingering malice.
pokecraft.species.zoroark.name: Zoroark
pokecraft.species.zoroark.desc: With its disheveled white fur, it looks like an embodiment of death. Heedless of its own safety, Zoroark attacks its nemeses with a bitter energy so intense, it lacerates Zoroark's own body.
pokecraft.species.minccino.name: Minccino
pokecraft.species.minccino.desc: They pet each other with their tails as a form of greeting. Of the two, the one whose tail is fluffier is a bit more boastful.
pokecraft.species.cinccino.name: Cinccino
pokecraft.species.cinccino.desc: A special oil that seeps through their fur helps them avoid attacks. The oil fetches a high price at market.
pokecraft.species.gothita.name: Gothita
pokecraft.species.gothita.desc: Even when nobody seems to be around, Gothita can still be heard making a muted cry. Many believe it’s speaking to something only it can see.
pokecraft.species.gothorita.name: Gothorita
pokecraft.species.gothorita.desc: On nights when the stars shine, this Pokémon’s psychic power is at its strongest. It’s unknown just what link Gothorita has to the greater universe.
pokecraft.species.gothitelle.name: Gothitelle
pokecraft.species.gothitelle.desc: A criminal who was shown his fate by a Gothitelle went missing that same day and was never seen again.
pokecraft.species.solosis.name: Solosis
pokecraft.species.solosis.desc: Many say that the special liquid covering this Pokémon’s body would allow it to survive in the vacuum of space.
pokecraft.species.duosion.name: Duosion
pokecraft.species.duosion.desc: Its brain has split into two, and the two halves rarely think alike. Its actions are utterly unpredictable.
pokecraft.species.reuniclus.name: Reuniclus
pokecraft.species.reuniclus.desc: It’s said that drinking the liquid surrounding Reuniclus grants wisdom. Problem is, the liquid is highly toxic to anything besides Reuniclus itself.
pokecraft.species.ducklett.name: Ducklett
pokecraft.species.ducklett.desc: They are better at swimming than flying, and they happily eat their favorite food, peat moss, as they dive underwater.
pokecraft.species.swanna.name: Swanna
pokecraft.species.swanna.desc: Swanna start to dance at dusk. The one dancing in the middle is the leader of the flock.
pokecraft.species.vanillite.name: Vanillite
pokecraft.species.vanillite.desc: Supposedly, this Pokémon was born from an icicle. It spews out freezing air at −58 degrees Fahrenheit to make itself more comfortable.
pokecraft.species.vanillish.name: Vanillish
pokecraft.species.vanillish.desc: It blasts enemies with cold air reaching −148 degrees Fahrenheit, freezing them solid. But it spares their lives afterward—it’s a kind Pokémon.
pokecraft.species.vanilluxe.name: Vanilluxe
pokecraft.species.vanilluxe.desc: People believe this Pokémon formed when two Vanillish stuck together. Its body temperature is roughly 21 degrees Fahrenheit.
pokecraft.species.deerling.name: Deerling
pokecraft.species.deerling.desc: The turning of the seasons changes the color and scent of this Pokémon’s fur. People use it to mark the seasons.
pokecraft.species.sawsbuck.name: Sawsbuck
pokecraft.species.sawsbuck.desc: They migrate according to the seasons, so some people call Sawsbuck the harbingers of spring.
pokecraft.species.emolga.name: Emolga
pokecraft.species.emolga.desc: This Pokémon absolutely loves sweet berries. Sometimes it stuffs its cheeks full of so much food that it can’t fly properly.
pokecraft.species.karrablast.name: Karrablast
pokecraft.species.karrablast.desc: It spits a liquid from its mouth to melt through Shelmet’s shell. Karrablast doesn’t eat the shell— it eats only the contents.
pokecraft.species.escavalier.name: Escavalier
pokecraft.species.escavalier.desc: It charges its enemies, lances at the ready. An image of one of its duels is captured in a famous painting of Escavalier clashing with Sirfetch’d.
pokecraft.species.foongus.name: Foongus
pokecraft.species.foongus.desc: The spores released from this Pokémon’s hands are highly poisonous, but when thoroughly dried, the spores can be used as stomach medicine.
pokecraft.species.amoonguss.name: Amoonguss
pokecraft.species.amoonguss.desc: Amoonguss generally doesn’t move much. It tends to stand still near Poké Balls that have been dropped on the ground.
pokecraft.species.frillish.name: Frillish
pokecraft.species.frillish.desc: Legend has it that the residents of a sunken ancient city changed into these Pokémon.
pokecraft.species.jellicent.name: Jellicent
pokecraft.species.jellicent.desc: Whenever a full moon hangs in the night sky, schools of Jellicent gather near the surface of the sea, waiting for their prey to appear.
pokecraft.species.alomomola.name: Alomomola
pokecraft.species.alomomola.desc: The reason it helps Pokémon in a weakened condition is that any Pokémon coming after them may also attack Alomomola.
pokecraft.species.joltik.name: Joltik
pokecraft.species.joltik.desc: Joltik latch on to other Pokémon and suck out static electricity. They’re often found sticking to Yamper’s hindquarters.
pokecraft.species.galvantula.name: Galvantula
pokecraft.species.galvantula.desc: It lays traps of electrified threads near the nests of bird Pokémon, aiming to snare chicks that are not yet good at flying.
pokecraft.species.ferroseed.name: Ferroseed
pokecraft.species.ferroseed.desc: Mossy caves are their preferred dwellings. Enzymes contained in mosses help Ferroseed’s spikes grow big and strong.
pokecraft.species.ferrothorn.name: Ferrothorn
pokecraft.species.ferrothorn.desc: Its spikes are harder than steel. This Pokémon crawls across rock walls by stabbing the spikes on its feelers into the stone.
pokecraft.species.klink.name: Klink
pokecraft.species.klink.desc: It’s suspected that Klink were the inspiration behind ancient people’s invention of the first gears.
pokecraft.species.klang.name: Klang
pokecraft.species.klang.desc: Many companies in the Galar region choose Klang as their logo. This Pokémon is considered the symbol of industrial technology.
pokecraft.species.klinklang.name: Klinklang
pokecraft.species.klinklang.desc: The three gears that compose this Pokémon spin at high speed. Its new spiked gear isn’t a living creature.
pokecraft.species.tynamo.name: Tynamo
pokecraft.species.tynamo.desc: One alone can emit only a trickle of electricity, so a group of them gathers to unleash a powerful electric shock.
pokecraft.species.eelektrik.name: Eelektrik
pokecraft.species.eelektrik.desc: These Pokémon have a big appetite. When they spot their prey, they attack it and paralyze it with electricity.
pokecraft.species.eelektross.name: Eelektross
pokecraft.species.eelektross.desc: They crawl out of the ocean using their arms. They will attack prey on shore and immediately drag it into the ocean.
pokecraft.species.elgyem.name: Elgyem
pokecraft.species.elgyem.desc: This Pokémon was discovered about 50 years ago. Its highly developed brain enables it to exert its psychic powers.
pokecraft.species.beheeyem.name: Beheeyem
pokecraft.species.beheeyem.desc: Sometimes found drifting above wheat fields, this Pokémon can control the memories of its opponents.
pokecraft.species.litwick.name: Litwick
pokecraft.species.litwick.desc: The younger the life this Pokémon absorbs, the brighter and eerier the flame on its head burns.
pokecraft.species.lampent.name: Lampent
pokecraft.species.lampent.desc: It lurks in cities, pretending to be a lamp. Once it finds someone whose death is near, it will trail quietly after them.
pokecraft.species.chandelure.name: Chandelure
pokecraft.species.chandelure.desc: In homes illuminated by Chandelure instead of lights, funerals were a constant occurrence— or so it’s said.
pokecraft.species.axew.name: Axew
pokecraft.species.axew.desc: They play with each other by knocking their large tusks together. Their tusks break sometimes, but they grow back so quickly that it isn’t a concern.
pokecraft.species.fraxure.name: Fraxure
pokecraft.species.fraxure.desc: Its skin is as hard as a suit of armor. Fraxure’s favorite strategy is to tackle its opponents, stabbing them with its tusks at the same time.
pokecraft.species.haxorus.name: Haxorus
pokecraft.species.haxorus.desc: While usually kindhearted, it can be terrifying if angered. Tusks that can slice through steel beams are how Haxorus deals with its adversaries.
pokecraft.species.cubchoo.name: Cubchoo
pokecraft.species.cubchoo.desc: It sniffles before performing a move, using its frosty snot to provide an icy element to any move that needs it.
pokecraft.species.beartic.name: Beartic
pokecraft.species.beartic.desc: It swims energetically through frigid seas. When it gets tired, it freezes the seawater with its breath so it can rest on the ice.
pokecraft.species.cryogonal.name: Cryogonal
pokecraft.species.cryogonal.desc: When the weather gets hot, these Pokémon turn into water vapor. Cryogonal are almost never seen during summer.
pokecraft.species.shelmet.name: Shelmet
pokecraft.species.shelmet.desc: It has a strange physiology that responds to electricity. When together with Karrablast, Shelmet evolves for some reason.
pokecraft.species.accelgor.name: Accelgor
pokecraft.species.accelgor.desc: Discarding its shell made it nimble. To keep itself from dehydrating, it wraps its body in bands of membrane.
pokecraft.species.stunfisk.name: Stunfisk
pokecraft.species.stunfisk.desc: For some reason, this Pokémon smiles slightly when it emits a strong electric current from the yellow markings on its body.
pokecraft.species.mienfoo.name: Mienfoo
pokecraft.species.mienfoo.desc: Though small, Mienfoo’s temperament is fierce. Any creature that approaches Mienfoo carelessly will be greeted with a flurry of graceful attacks.
pokecraft.species.mienshao.name: Mienshao
pokecraft.species.mienshao.desc: Delivered at blinding speeds, kicks from this Pokémon can shatter massive boulders into tiny pieces.
pokecraft.species.druddigon.name: Druddigon
pokecraft.species.druddigon.desc: Druddigon are vicious and cunning. They take up residence in nests dug out by other Pokémon, treating the stolen nests as their own lairs.
pokecraft.species.golett.name: Golett
pokecraft.species.golett.desc: This Pokémon was created from clay. It received orders from its master many thousands of years ago, and it still follows those orders to this day.
pokecraft.species.golurk.name: Golurk
pokecraft.species.golurk.desc: There’s a theory that inside Golurk is a perpetual motion machine that produces limitless energy, but this belief hasn’t been proven.
pokecraft.species.pawniard.name: Pawniard
pokecraft.species.pawniard.desc: A pack of these Pokémon forms to serve a Bisharp boss. Each Pawniard trains diligently, dreaming of one day taking the lead.
pokecraft.species.bisharp.name: Bisharp
pokecraft.species.bisharp.desc: Violent conflicts erupt between Bisharp and Fraxure over places where sharpening stones can be found.
pokecraft.species.bouffalant.name: Bouffalant
pokecraft.species.bouffalant.desc: These Pokémon live in herds of about 20 individuals. Bouffalant that betray the herd will lose the hair on their heads for some reason.
pokecraft.species.rufflet.name: Rufflet
pokecraft.species.rufflet.desc: Its chick-like looks belie its hotheadedness. It challenges its parents at every opportunity, desperate to prove its strength.
pokecraft.species.braviary.name: Braviary
pokecraft.species.braviary.desc: Screaming a bloodcurdling battle cry, this huge and ferocious bird Pokémon goes out on the hunt. It blasts lakes with shock waves, then scoops up any prey that float to the water's surface.
pokecraft.species.vullaby.name: Vullaby
pokecraft.species.vullaby.desc: Vullaby grow quickly. Bones that have gotten too small for older Vullaby to wear often get passed down to younger ones in the nest.
pokecraft.species.mandibuzz.name: Mandibuzz
pokecraft.species.mandibuzz.desc: They adorn themselves with bones. There seem to be fashion trends among them, as different bones come into and fall out of popularity.
pokecraft.species.heatmor.name: Heatmor
pokecraft.species.heatmor.desc: A flame serves as its tongue, melting through the hard shell of Durant so that Heatmor can devour their insides.
pokecraft.species.durant.name: Durant
pokecraft.species.durant.desc: With their large mandibles, these Pokémon can crunch their way through rock. They work together to protect their eggs from Sandaconda.
pokecraft.species.deino.name: Deino
pokecraft.species.deino.desc: Because it can’t see, this Pokémon is constantly biting at everything it touches, trying to keep track of its surroundings.
pokecraft.species.zweilous.name: Zweilous
pokecraft.species.zweilous.desc: Their two heads will fight each other over a single piece of food. Zweilous are covered in scars even without battling others.
pokecraft.species.hydreigon.name: Hydreigon
pokecraft.species.hydreigon.desc: The three heads take turns sinking their teeth into the opponent. Their attacks won’t slow until their target goes down.
pokecraft.species.larvesta.name: Larvesta
pokecraft.species.larvesta.desc: Larvesta’s body is warm all over. It spouts fire from the tips of its horns to intimidate predators and scare prey.
pokecraft.species.volcarona.name: Volcarona
pokecraft.species.volcarona.desc: This Pokémon emerges from a cocoon formed of raging flames. Ancient murals depict Volcarona as a deity of fire.
pokecraft.species.cobalion.name: Cobalion
pokecraft.species.cobalion.desc: From the moment it’s born, this Pokémon radiates the air of a leader. Its presence will calm even vicious foes.
pokecraft.species.terrakion.name: Terrakion
pokecraft.species.terrakion.desc: In Unovan legend, Terrakion battled against humans in an effort to protect other Pokémon.
pokecraft.species.virizion.name: Virizion
pokecraft.species.virizion.desc: It darts around opponents with a flurry of quick movements, slicing them up with its horns.
pokecraft.species.tornadus.name: Tornadus
pokecraft.species.tornadus.desc: This storm-stirring Pokémon is said to cause the seasons to turn by whipping up the air. I suspect its human_like form to be a false one.
pokecraft.species.thundurus.name: Thundurus
pokecraft.species.thundurus.desc: They say this wielder of electricity has waged war with its nemesis, Tornadus, since time immemorial. The lightning bolts it hurls pierce the very earth and enrich the soil.
pokecraft.species.reshiram.name: Reshiram
pokecraft.species.reshiram.desc: According to myth, if people ignore truth and let themselves become consumed by greed, Reshiram will arrive to burn their kingdoms down.
pokecraft.species.zekrom.name: Zekrom
pokecraft.species.zekrom.desc: Mythology tells us that if people lose the righteousness in their hearts, their kingdoms will be razed by Zekrom’s lightning.
pokecraft.species.landorus.name: Landorus
pokecraft.species.landorus.desc: When the incarnations of wind and of lightning clash, Landorus arrives to quell the conflict. After the tempests and thunderbolts abate, the land is sure to be blessed with bountiful harvests.
pokecraft.species.kyurem.name: Kyurem
pokecraft.species.kyurem.desc: It appears that this Pokémon uses its powers over ice to freeze its own body in order to stabilize its cellular structure.
pokecraft.species.keldeo.name: Keldeo
pokecraft.species.keldeo.desc: They say that Keldeo must survive harsh battles and fully develop the horn on its forehead before this Pokémon’s true power will awaken.
pokecraft.species.meloetta.name: Meloetta
pokecraft.species.meloetta.desc: Its melodies are sung with a special vocalization method that can control the feelings of those who hear it.
pokecraft.species.genesect.name: Genesect
pokecraft.species.genesect.desc: This Pokémon existed 300 million years ago. Team Plasma altered it and attached a cannon to its back.
pokecraft.species.chespin.name: Chespin
pokecraft.species.chespin.desc: Such a thick shell of wood covers its head and back that even a direct hit from a truck wouldn’t faze it.
pokecraft.species.quilladin.name: Quilladin
pokecraft.species.quilladin.desc: They strengthen their lower bodies by running into one another. They are very kind and won’t start fights.
pokecraft.species.chesnaught.name: Chesnaught
pokecraft.species.chesnaught.desc: When it takes a defensive posture with its fists guarding its face, it could withstand a bomb blast.
pokecraft.species.fennekin.name: Fennekin
pokecraft.species.fennekin.desc: As it walks, it munches on a twig in place of a snack. It intimidates opponents by puffing hot air out of its ears.
pokecraft.species.braixen.name: Braixen
pokecraft.species.braixen.desc: When the twig is plucked from its tail, friction sets the twig alight. The flame is used to send signals to its allies.
pokecraft.species.delphox.name: Delphox
pokecraft.species.delphox.desc: Using psychic power, it generates a fiery vortex of 5,400 degrees Fahrenheit, incinerating foes swept into this whirl of flame.
pokecraft.species.froakie.name: Froakie
pokecraft.species.froakie.desc: It protects its skin by covering its body in delicate bubbles. Beneath its happy-go-lucky air, it keeps a watchful eye on its surroundings.
pokecraft.species.frogadier.name: Frogadier
pokecraft.species.frogadier.desc: Its swiftness is unparalleled. It can scale a tower of more than 2,000 feet in a minute’s time.
pokecraft.species.greninja.name: Greninja
pokecraft.species.greninja.desc: It appears and vanishes with a ninja’s grace. It toys with its enemies using swift movements, while slicing them with throwing stars of sharpest water.
pokecraft.species.bunnelby.name: Bunnelby
pokecraft.species.bunnelby.desc: It’s very sensitive to danger. The sound of Corviknight’s flapping will have Bunnelby digging a hole to hide underground in moments.
pokecraft.species.diggersby.name: Diggersby
pokecraft.species.diggersby.desc: The fur on its belly retains heat exceptionally well. People used to make heavy winter clothing from fur shed by this Pokémon.
pokecraft.species.fletchling.name: Fletchling
pokecraft.species.fletchling.desc: When this Pokémon gets excited, its body temperature increases sharply. If you touch a Fletchling with bare hands, you might get burned.
pokecraft.species.fletchinder.name: Fletchinder
pokecraft.species.fletchinder.desc: Fletchinder are exceedingly territorial and aggressive. These Pokémon fight among themselves over feeding grounds.
pokecraft.species.talonflame.name: Talonflame
pokecraft.species.talonflame.desc: Talonflame dives toward prey at speeds of up to 310 mph and assaults them with powerful kicks, giving the prey no chance to escape.
pokecraft.species.scatterbug.name: Scatterbug
pokecraft.species.scatterbug.desc: The powder that covers its body regulates its temperature, so it can live in any region or climate.
pokecraft.species.spewpa.name: Spewpa
pokecraft.species.spewpa.desc: The beaks of bird Pokémon can’t begin to scratch its stalwart body. To defend itself, it spews powder.
pokecraft.species.vivillon.name: Vivillon
pokecraft.species.vivillon.desc: The patterns on this Pokémon’s wings depend on the climate and topography of its habitat. It scatters colorful scales.
pokecraft.species.litleo.name: Litleo
pokecraft.species.litleo.desc: This hot-blooded Pokémon is filled with curiosity. When it gets angry or starts fighting, its short mane gets hot.
pokecraft.species.pyroar.name: Pyroar
pokecraft.species.pyroar.desc: The temperature of its breath is over 10,000 degrees Fahrenheit, but Pyroar doesn’t use it on its prey. This Pokémon prefers to eat raw meat.
pokecraft.species.flabebe.name: Flabébé
pokecraft.species.flabebe.desc: Flabébé wears a crown made from pollen it’s collected from its flower. The crown has hidden healing properties.
pokecraft.species.floette.name: Floette
pokecraft.species.floette.desc: It gives its own power to flowers, pouring its heart into caring for them. Floette never forgives anyone who messes up a flower bed.
pokecraft.species.florges.name: Florges
pokecraft.species.florges.desc: Its life can span several hundred years. It’s said to devote its entire life to protecting gardens.
pokecraft.species.skiddo.name: Skiddo
pokecraft.species.skiddo.desc: If it has sunshine and water, it doesn’t need to eat, because it can generate energy from the leaves on its back.
pokecraft.species.gogoat.name: Gogoat
pokecraft.species.gogoat.desc: They inhabit mountainous regions. The leader of the herd is decided by a battle of clashing horns.
pokecraft.species.pancham.name: Pancham
pokecraft.species.pancham.desc: Wanting to make sure it’s taken seriously, Pancham’s always giving others a glare. But if it’s not focusing, it ends up smiling.
pokecraft.species.pangoro.name: Pangoro
pokecraft.species.pangoro.desc: Using its leaf, Pangoro can predict the moves of its opponents. It strikes with punches that can turn a dump truck into scrap with just one hit.
pokecraft.species.furfrou.name: Furfrou
pokecraft.species.furfrou.desc: Left alone, its fur will grow longer and longer, but it will only allow someone it trusts to cut it.
pokecraft.species.espurr.name: Espurr
pokecraft.species.espurr.desc: There’s enough psychic power in Espurr to send a wrestler flying, but because this power can’t be controlled, Espurr finds it troublesome.
pokecraft.species.meowstic.name: Meowstic
pokecraft.species.meowstic.desc: The defensive instinct of the males is strong. It’s when they’re protecting themselves or their partners that they unleash their full power.
pokecraft.species.honedge.name: Honedge
pokecraft.species.honedge.desc: The blue eye on the sword’s handguard is the true body of Honedge. With its old cloth, it drains people’s lives away.
pokecraft.species.doublade.name: Doublade
pokecraft.species.doublade.desc: The two swords employ a strategy of rapidly alternating between offense and defense to bring down their prey.
pokecraft.species.aegislash.name: Aegislash
pokecraft.species.aegislash.desc: Its potent spectral powers allow it to manipulate others. It once used its powers to force people and Pokémon to build a kingdom to its liking.
pokecraft.species.spritzee.name: Spritzee
pokecraft.species.spritzee.desc: The scent its body gives off enraptures those who smell it. Noble ladies had no shortage of love for Spritzee.
pokecraft.species.aromatisse.name: Aromatisse
pokecraft.species.aromatisse.desc: The scents Aromatisse can produce range from sweet smells that bolster allies to foul smells that sap an opponent’s will to fight.
pokecraft.species.swirlix.name: Swirlix
pokecraft.species.swirlix.desc: The sweet smell of cotton candy perfumes Swirlix’s fluffy fur. This Pokémon spits out sticky string to tangle up its enemies.
pokecraft.species.slurpuff.name: Slurpuff
pokecraft.species.slurpuff.desc: Slurpuff’s fur contains a lot of air, making it soft to the touch and lighter than it looks.
pokecraft.species.inkay.name: Inkay
pokecraft.species.inkay.desc: By exposing foes to the blinking of its luminescent spots, Inkay demoralizes them, and then it seizes the chance to flee.
pokecraft.species.malamar.name: Malamar
pokecraft.species.malamar.desc: It’s said that Malamar’s hypnotic powers played a role in certain history-changing events.
pokecraft.species.binacle.name: Binacle
pokecraft.species.binacle.desc: If the two don’t work well together, both their offense and defense fall apart. Without good teamwork, they won’t survive.
pokecraft.species.barbaracle.name: Barbaracle
pokecraft.species.barbaracle.desc: Having an eye on each palm allows it to keep watch in all directions. In a pinch, its limbs start to act on their own to ensure the enemy’s defeat.
pokecraft.species.skrelp.name: Skrelp
pokecraft.species.skrelp.desc: Skrelp looks like a piece of rotten seaweed, so it can blend in with seaweed drifting on the ocean and avoid being detected by enemies.
pokecraft.species.dragalge.name: Dragalge
pokecraft.species.dragalge.desc: Dragalge generates dragon energy by sticking the plume on its head out above the ocean’s surface and bathing it in sunlight.
pokecraft.species.clauncher.name: Clauncher
pokecraft.species.clauncher.desc: By detonating gas that accumulates in its right claw, this Pokémon launches water like a bullet. This is how Clauncher defeats its enemies.
pokecraft.species.clawitzer.name: Clawitzer
pokecraft.species.clawitzer.desc: Clawitzer’s right arm is a cannon that launches projectiles made of seawater. Shots from a Clawitzer’s cannon arm can sink a tanker.
pokecraft.species.helioptile.name: Helioptile
pokecraft.species.helioptile.desc: The sun powers this Pokémon’s electricity generation. Interruption of that process stresses Helioptile to the point of weakness.
pokecraft.species.heliolisk.name: Heliolisk
pokecraft.species.heliolisk.desc: One Heliolisk basking in the sun with its frill outspread is all it would take to produce enough electricity to power a city.
pokecraft.species.tyrunt.name: Tyrunt
pokecraft.species.tyrunt.desc: This Pokémon is selfish and likes to be pampered. It can also inflict grievous wounds on its Trainer just by playing around.
pokecraft.species.tyrantrum.name: Tyrantrum
pokecraft.species.tyrantrum.desc: A single bite of Tyrantrum’s massive jaws will demolish a car. This Pokémon was the king of the ancient world.
pokecraft.species.amaura.name: Amaura
pokecraft.species.amaura.desc: Amaura is an ancient Pokémon that has gone extinct. Specimens of this species can sometimes be found frozen in ice.
pokecraft.species.aurorus.name: Aurorus
pokecraft.species.aurorus.desc: When gripped by rage, Aurorus will emanate freezing air, covering everything around it in ice.
pokecraft.species.sylveon.name: Sylveon
pokecraft.species.sylveon.desc: It emits a soothing aura from its ribbon-shaped organs. It wraps these appendages around quarrelers to instantly restore calm to the situation.
pokecraft.species.hawlucha.name: Hawlucha
pokecraft.species.hawlucha.desc: It always strikes a pose before going for its finishing move. Sometimes opponents take advantage of that time to counterattack.
pokecraft.species.dedenne.name: Dedenne
pokecraft.species.dedenne.desc: Since Dedenne can’t generate much electricity on its own, it steals electricity from outlets or other electric Pokémon.
pokecraft.species.carbink.name: Carbink
pokecraft.species.carbink.desc: It’s said that somewhere in the world, there’s a mineral vein housing a large pack of slumbering Carbink. It’s also said that this pack has a queen.
pokecraft.species.goomy.name: Goomy
pokecraft.species.goomy.desc: Goomy hides away in the shade of trees, where it's nice and humid. If the slime coating its body dries out, the Pokémon instantly becomes lethargic.
pokecraft.species.sliggoo.name: Sliggoo
pokecraft.species.sliggoo.desc: A creature given to melancholy. I suspect its metallic shell developed as a result of the mucus on its skin reacting with the iron in Hisui's water.
pokecraft.species.goodra.name: Goodra
pokecraft.species.goodra.desc: Able to freely control the hardness of its metallic shell. It loathes solitude and is extremely clingy—it will fume and run riot if those dearest to it ever leave its side.
pokecraft.species.klefki.name: Klefki
pokecraft.species.klefki.desc: Klefki sucks in metal ions with the horn topping its head. It seems this Pokémon loves keys so much that its head needed to look like one, too.
pokecraft.species.phantump.name: Phantump
pokecraft.species.phantump.desc: With a voice like a human child’s, it cries out to lure adults deep into the forest, getting them lost among the trees.
pokecraft.species.trevenant.name: Trevenant
pokecraft.species.trevenant.desc: Small roots that extend from the tips of this Pokémon’s feet can tie into the trees of the forest and give Trevenant control over them.
pokecraft.species.pumpkaboo.name: Pumpkaboo
pokecraft.species.pumpkaboo.desc: The light that streams out from the holes in the pumpkin can hypnotize and control the people and Pokémon that see it.
pokecraft.species.gourgeist.name: Gourgeist
pokecraft.species.gourgeist.desc: In the darkness of a new-moon night, Gourgeist will come knocking. Whoever answers the door will be swept off to the afterlife.
pokecraft.species.bergmite.name: Bergmite
pokecraft.species.bergmite.desc: Lives on mountains blanketed in perennial snow. It freezes water vapor in the air to make the ice helmet that it dons for defense.
pokecraft.species.avalugg.name: Avalugg
pokecraft.species.avalugg.desc: The armor of ice covering its lower jaw puts steel to shame and can shatter rocks with ease. This Pokémon barrels along steep mountain paths, cleaving through the deep snow.
pokecraft.species.noibat.name: Noibat
pokecraft.species.noibat.desc: No wavelength of sound is beyond Noibat’s ability to produce. The ultrasonic waves it generates can overcome much larger Pokémon.
pokecraft.species.noivern.name: Noivern
pokecraft.species.noivern.desc: Flying through the darkness, it weakens enemies with ultrasonic waves that could crush stone. Its fangs finish the fight.
pokecraft.species.xerneas.name: Xerneas
pokecraft.species.xerneas.desc: When the horns on its head shine in seven colors, it is said to be sharing everlasting life.
pokecraft.species.yveltal.name: Yveltal
pokecraft.species.yveltal.desc: When its life comes to an end, it absorbs the life energy of every living thing and turns into a cocoon once more.
pokecraft.species.zygarde.name: Zygarde
pokecraft.species.zygarde.desc: Some say it can change to an even more powerful form when battling those who threaten the ecosystem.
pokecraft.species.diancie.name: Diancie
pokecraft.species.diancie.desc: It can instantly create many diamonds by compressing the carbon in the air between its hands.
pokecraft.species.hoopa.name: Hoopa
pokecraft.species.hoopa.desc: It is said to be able to seize anything it desires with its six rings and six huge arms. With its power sealed, it is transformed into a much smaller form.
pokecraft.species.volcanion.name: Volcanion
pokecraft.species.volcanion.desc: It expels its internal steam from the arms on its back. It has enough power to blow away a mountain.
pokecraft.species.rowlet.name: Rowlet
pokecraft.species.rowlet.desc: Flies noiselessly on delicate wings. It has mastered the art of deftly launching dagger-sharp feathers from those same wings.
pokecraft.species.dartrix.name: Dartrix
pokecraft.species.dartrix.desc: Regularly basks in sunlight to gather power—presumably due to the frigid climate. Nonetheless, the edges of the blade quills set into its wings are keen as ever.
pokecraft.species.decidueye.name: Decidueye
pokecraft.species.decidueye.desc: The air stored inside the rachises of Decidueye's feathers insulates the Pokémon against Hisui's extreme cold. This is firm proof that evolution can be influenced by environment.
pokecraft.species.litten.name: Litten
pokecraft.species.litten.desc: Trying to pet Litten before it trusts you will result in a nasty scratch from its sharp claws. Be careful.
pokecraft.species.torracat.name: Torracat
pokecraft.species.torracat.desc: When facing a powerful enemy, Torracat’s fighting spirit gets pumped up, and its fire bell blazes hotter.
pokecraft.species.incineroar.name: Incineroar
pokecraft.species.incineroar.desc: Incineroar’s rough and aggressive behavior is its most notable trait, but the way it helps out small Pokémon shows that it has a kind side as well.
pokecraft.species.popplio.name: Popplio
pokecraft.species.popplio.desc: If Popplio want to create big, powerful balloons, they must be persistent. It takes daily practice for these Pokémon to develop their skills.
pokecraft.species.brionne.name: Brionne
pokecraft.species.brionne.desc: On nights when the sea is calm, Brionne dance with one another to the singing of the Primarina that’s leading them.
pokecraft.species.primarina.name: Primarina
pokecraft.species.primarina.desc: For Primarina, every battle’s a stage. Its singing and the dancing of its balloons will mesmerize the audience.
pokecraft.species.pikipek.name: Pikipek
pokecraft.species.pikipek.desc: It may look spindly, but its neck muscles are heavy-duty. It can peck at a tree 16 times per second!
pokecraft.species.trumbeak.name: Trumbeak
pokecraft.species.trumbeak.desc: From its mouth, it fires the seeds of berries it has eaten. The scattered seeds give rise to new plants.
pokecraft.species.toucannon.name: Toucannon
pokecraft.species.toucannon.desc: Known for forming harmonious couples, this Pokémon is brought to wedding ceremonies as a good luck charm.
pokecraft.species.yungoos.name: Yungoos
pokecraft.species.yungoos.desc: Although it will eat anything, it prefers fresh living things, so it marches down streets in search of prey.
pokecraft.species.gumshoos.name: Gumshoos
pokecraft.species.gumshoos.desc: Patient by nature, this Pokémon loses control of itself and pounces when it spots its favorite meal—Rattata!
pokecraft.species.grubbin.name: Grubbin
pokecraft.species.grubbin.desc: It uses its big jaws to dig nests into the forest floor, and it loves to feed on sweet tree sap.
pokecraft.species.charjabug.name: Charjabug
pokecraft.species.charjabug.desc: Its digestive processes convert the leaves it eats into electricity. An electric sac in its belly stores the electricity for later use.
pokecraft.species.vikavolt.name: Vikavolt
pokecraft.species.vikavolt.desc: If it carries a Charjabug to use as a spare battery, a flying Vikavolt can rapidly fire high-powered beams of electricity.
pokecraft.species.crabrawler.name: Crabrawler
pokecraft.species.crabrawler.desc: Crabrawler has been known to mistake Exeggutor for a coconut tree and climb it. The enraged Exeggutor shakes it off and stomps it.
pokecraft.species.crabominable.name: Crabominable
pokecraft.species.crabominable.desc: Before it stops to think, it just starts pummeling. There are records of its turning back avalanches with a flurry of punches.
pokecraft.species.oricorio.name: Oricorio
pokecraft.species.oricorio.desc: This Oricorio has drunk red nectar. If its Trainer gives the wrong order, this passionate Pokémon becomes fiercely angry.
pokecraft.species.cutiefly.name: Cutiefly
pokecraft.species.cutiefly.desc: An opponent’s aura can tell Cutiefly what that opponent’s next move will be. Then Cutiefly can glide around the attack and strike back.
pokecraft.species.ribombee.name: Ribombee
pokecraft.species.ribombee.desc: Ribombee absolutely hate getting wet or rained on. In the cloudy Galar region, they are very seldom seen.
pokecraft.species.rockruff.name: Rockruff
pokecraft.species.rockruff.desc: This Pokémon intimidates opponents by striking the ground with the rocks on its neck. The moment an opponent flinches, Rockruff attacks.
pokecraft.species.lycanroc.name: Lycanroc
pokecraft.species.lycanroc.desc: With swift movements, this Pokémon gradually backs its prey into a corner. Lycanroc’s fangs are always aimed toward opponents’ weak spots.
pokecraft.species.wishiwashi.name: Wishiwashi
pokecraft.species.wishiwashi.desc: When it senses danger, its eyes tear up. The sparkle of its tears signals other Wishiwashi to gather.
pokecraft.species.mareanie.name: Mareanie
pokecraft.species.mareanie.desc: Unlike their Alolan counterparts, the Mareanie of the Galar region have not yet figured out that the branches of Corsola are delicious.
pokecraft.species.toxapex.name: Toxapex
pokecraft.species.toxapex.desc: Within the poison sac in its body is a poison so toxic that Pokémon as large as Wailord will still be suffering three days after it first takes effect.
pokecraft.species.mudbray.name: Mudbray
pokecraft.species.mudbray.desc: It eats dirt to create mud and smears this mud all over its feet, giving them the grip needed to walk on rough terrain without slipping.
pokecraft.species.mudsdale.name: Mudsdale
pokecraft.species.mudsdale.desc: Mudsdale has so much stamina that it could carry over 10 tons across the Galar region without rest or sleep.
pokecraft.species.dewpider.name: Dewpider
pokecraft.species.dewpider.desc: Dewpider normally lives underwater. When it comes onto land in search of food, it takes water with it in the form of a bubble on its head.
pokecraft.species.araquanid.name: Araquanid
pokecraft.species.araquanid.desc: It acts as a caretaker for Dewpider, putting them inside its bubble and letting them eat any leftover food.
pokecraft.species.fomantis.name: Fomantis
pokecraft.species.fomantis.desc: During the day, Fomantis basks in sunlight and sleeps peacefully. It wakes and moves around at night.
pokecraft.species.lurantis.name: Lurantis
pokecraft.species.lurantis.desc: The petals on this Pokémon’s arms are thin and super sharp, and they can fire laser beams if Lurantis gathers light first.
pokecraft.species.morelull.name: Morelull
pokecraft.species.morelull.desc: Morelull live in forests that stay dark even during the day. They scatter flickering spores that put enemies to sleep.
pokecraft.species.shiinotic.name: Shiinotic
pokecraft.species.shiinotic.desc: If you see a light deep in a forest at night, don’t go near. Shiinotic will make you fall fast asleep.
pokecraft.species.salandit.name: Salandit
pokecraft.species.salandit.desc: This sneaky Pokémon will slink behind its prey and immobilize it with poisonous gas before the prey even realizes Salandit is there.
pokecraft.species.salazzle.name: Salazzle
pokecraft.species.salazzle.desc: The winner of competitions between Salazzle is decided by which one has the most male Salandit with it.
pokecraft.species.stufful.name: Stufful
pokecraft.species.stufful.desc: The way it protects itself by flailing its arms may be an adorable sight, but stay well away. This is flailing that can snap thick tree trunks.
pokecraft.species.bewear.name: Bewear
pokecraft.species.bewear.desc: The moves it uses to take down its prey would make a martial artist jealous. It tucks subdued prey under its arms to carry them to its nest.
pokecraft.species.bounsweet.name: Bounsweet
pokecraft.species.bounsweet.desc: When under attack, it secretes a sweet and delicious sweat. The scent only calls more enemies to it.
pokecraft.species.steenee.name: Steenee
